page.title: 18Recent News Items
page.content: {1941}Thurso soldier Big Jock Campbell was awarded his VC for bravery. He was born in Traill St. One month after he was awarded his V.C. he was killed in a car accident. {1955 }Dounreay reactor was opened for many workers of Caithness. {1961 }Pennyland Estate was finished for people to live in. {1961 }There was a school built for the workers' children and it was called Pennyland School. Pennyland means a 12 acre plot. An acre used to cost 1p. {1961 }In August that year the Queen Mother visited Dounreay. {1967}Robert Maclennan,MP for Caithness & Sutherland opened the Swimming Pool. {1979 }Mrs. Thatcher,the Prime Minister visited Dounreay with her husband and was presented with a gift. {1980 }The shopping precinct was built and caused disruption to traders.
